title: Parque Eduardo VII
description: The central park in Lisbon is known for its rolling hills and undulating lawns. As you wander around here, look back over the downtown area of the city for views that stretch as far as the river.

facilities.others: Playground and a water fountain. Lots and lots of places for walking the dog or have a good nap.

title: Ponta da Piedade
description: Although Ponta da Piedade is typically filled with tourists, I still recommend checking it out. I regret that I didn’t spend more time there! I knew I wanted to make a boat trip during my time in the Algarve but ended up doing this at Benagil beach to see the famous Benagil Cave (side note: it was a little expensive but worth snapping a photo here). In my opinion, if you’re hoping to see grottos and save a little cash, considering going on one of the boat tours here at Ponta da Piedade. This location offers activities such as hiking, kayaking, and stand up paddleboarding.

title: Barrinha de Esmoriz
description: Barrinha de Esmoriz or Lagoa de Paramos is a coastal brackish lagoon with an area of ​​396 hectares. The Paramos Lagoon is located between the municipalities of Espinho and Ovar bathing the village of Paramos and the city of Esmoriz.

facilities.others: This area is fed by waters from two streams - the Silvalde ditch, which has its mouth on the north side of the lagoon and the Maceda / Rio Lambo ditch which flows into its south side - which due to the coastal dune cord originate the central body of the pond. Originated by the deposition of sand near the mouth of a small water line, the dune cord that is opened seasonally for water renewal.

title: Parque da Cidade - Porto
description: Parque da Cidade do Porto, is considered the largest urban park in the country, the naturalized green areas extend to the Atlantic Ocean, giving it a rare peculiarity worldwide.

title: Parque Natural da Ribeira dos Caldeirões
description: Ribeira dos Caldeirões Natural Park is an Azorean protected area, located along part of the Ribeira dos Caldeirões watercourse, in the parish of Achada, municipality of Nordeste, on the island of São Miguel. This natural park is located on the slopes of Serra da Tronqueira and occupies part of the Ribeira do Guilherme course, where the Ribeira do Guilherme Botanical Garden is also located.

title: Parque D. Carlos I
description: Parque D. Carlos I is located in the city of Caldas da Rainha, in the District of Leiria, in Portugal. It is a romantic garden, attached to the Rainha D. Leonor Thermal Hospital. It was named after King Carlos I of Portugal.

title: Praia da Apúlia
description: Extensive sandy beach, where there are some rocky outcrops to the north. It ends at the jetty to the south. Wooden walkways allow easier access to the sand. Windmills transformed into housing to crown an old dune.

facilities.others: Consult the updated bulletins with the Maritime Authority, check the zones and special concessions for the practice of activity.

title: Praia de S. Jacinto
description: São Jacinto Beach is located next to Canal da Barra, at the southern end of a long strip of land that separates the Ria de Aveiro from the sea. For those in Aveiro, the fastest transport to get to São Jacinto is the boat that crosses the Ria on regular connections, since to come by car it is necessary to go to Torreira or Ovar, where there are bridges, and then return south .

facilities.others: At the limits of the Natural Reserve of the Dunes of São Jacinto, a protected area where unique species of fauna and flora are conserved, this beach has an extensive sand, in an almost wild state. Not always guarded, São Jacinto Beach offers excellent conditions for surfing, and for long walks, in a sand that extends to the north with no end in sight.
